Reviews.Title: Excellent TV !!
Reviews.Author: Lisa D
Reviews.Content: Hisense is giving big name brands a run for their money!  We now own 3 Hisense TV's.  I've always been a big fan of Samsung and trying a brand that was new to the TV market was a little scary; however, for all the bells and whistles that this TV offers stacked up against another brand with same features - this TV was half the cost!  We've had the 46" Hisense TV for about 6 months.  The 65" and a 42" Hisense, we've had for a little over a month. So far so good. Plug and play out of the box, but those who like to tweek I think just about everything in this TV can be!  Also, we love all the inputs and we are using most of them!Can't really comment on Wi-fi features as we have ethernet wired in the house and the 65" has our media center computer hooked to it.  TV sound is OK but let's face it - if you are considering a 65" TV you would likely have some sort of home theater system.  Love the slim design and frame.3D features are awesome!  Even the 2D to 3D conversion looks great!  It adds more depth to a 2D movie. But WOW - watch a movie that was actually filmed in 3D and things jump out at you!  You can tell the difference between a movie that was "remade" in 3D versus a movie that was filmed in 3D.  Not the TV's fault by any means - just sharing there is a difference.  Unfortunately there are not a lot of movies to choose from at this point that were filmed in 3D.  Avatar and Step UP Revolution (the 4th movie in Step Up series) were filmed in 3D.  There are some others but these two are my favorites for 3D effects.One thing to mention - the 65" is so new that Hisense employees don't know much about it yet.  The TV shipped with 2 pairs of active 3D glasses model # FPS3D06.  They have active shutters and run on batteries that are not rechargeable.  If you want additional pairs of the same model, you will have to order from China.  I found them on E-Bay.  If you want rechargeable glasses (which we prefer) call Hisense USA and order model FPS3D02.  These are interchangeable with the FPS3D06 that come with the TV.  If you see on the internet somewhere that model FPS3D05 is compatible with the 65" TV - beware they are not!  The 05's are RF glasses and do work with our 42" Hisense.  The 65" TV transmits an IR signal for 3D glasses.We are not usually "trail blazers" on new technology but when we saw the price of this TV compared to other brands with same features we thought we'd give them a try.  To this point we have not been disappointed. Exceptional TV for an exceptional price!

Reviews.Title: High quality 65" tv, budget price, but with motion issues
Reviews.Author: Jon Langevin
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Hisense 65" at $1499, can't beat that price (free shipping on prime).Comes with VUDU and Netflix apps, no Amazon (love Amazon video, hopefully that's added soon).TV has a solid base, quite heavy actually, requires assembly. Assembly was relatively simple, and swivel on base works quite well.Watched Tron: Legacy in 3D on the tv, looked amazing. That movie has heavy use of blacks, and some great 3D effects, all came across quite well.Love the remote. TV was easy to set up, easy to use.Screen is apparently made by Hitachi, which explains the high quality. There's nothing about this TV to suggest low quality or budget, aside from the brand name that people won't recognize :-)Only complaints that I have:- No Amazon Instant Video app (not a major negative, since I can watch via game consoles)- No setting to disable the "soap opera effect" (motion interpolation). According to google search, other users have found same issue, they contacted support, and were sent a USB stick with an updated firmware which provides setting to disable motion interpolation. I'm contacting support later today to make same request.- Remote has no keyboard, which is almost necessary when using a "Smart" tv.EDIT (5-21-2013):  ** Dropping score to 3 starsWhile I love the size and picture quality of this tv (and hell, the price was awesome), I'm on the verge of returning it to Amazon.While watching Southland Season 5 via VUDU (on PS3), I'm noticing problems with motion stutter/jutter/lag.This issue is due to Motion Interpolation being forced on (no setting to turn it off), so while sports & racing looks phenomenal, TV programs tend to suffer.Hisense CSRs are responsive and try to be helpful, but there is no firmware update for this model yet, so there's no way for me to turn off motion interpolation to fix video playback.I'm waiting to hear back a final response from Hisense, at which point I'll decide whether it's worthwhile to return the tv.What sucks is, there's no similarly featured LED tv at the same price on Amazon. I may need to switch over to Plasma, since that doesn't suffer motion issues...EDIT (6-5-2013):I ended up returning the TV to Amazon, replacing it with a Vizio 70" (2d).There aren't enough (good) 3D movies out currently, so losing 3D won't affect me.The Vizio tv operates great though. No issues with the "Soap Opera effect". Theoretically I would experience the effect if I turned Vizio's motion setting up, but leaving it on the default low setting doesn't give me the same poor experience as I noticed with Hisense.TV broadcasts, DVDs, Blurays, and streamed HD movies, all play back properly, and look great.Shame the Hisense couldn't deliver the same, I did like that TV, but Vizio's app support is better, the remote has a keyboard built in, and picture looks great.Kudos to Amazon on their excellent support staff, for letting me easily swap out tvs.

Reviews.Title: all hisense televisions are junk!
Reviews.Author: david flynn
Reviews.Content: this is my second tv from this company and the second one to fail to panel malfunction. my last one was a 50k360g and was sent in around thanks giving last year and i still have not recived my refund. my last model was a 2012 model and they didnt have parts in 2013 . so i thought to myself maybe i just got a bad one and bought a new one but sure enough 4 weeks and 3 days later this model fails from the same problem as the last one i had and because hisense has the worst customer service i have ever experienced in my life i brought it back to walmart and sat there until they took it back.  in my opinion this brand is complete trash and should be pulled pulled from all stores immediately.

Reviews.Title: not a usa brand to buy yet.
Reviews.Author: Keith w Taylor
Reviews.Content: The picture is great.  The firmware is s***.  Cant turn of smooth motion unless you change it to 3d and set the focus to 12 this is the only work around.  Hisense customer service in the USA sucks.  The 800 number hanges up on you.  If you do get someone on the phone they are rude.I would have returned it but what a pain in the ass.  I kept it.  Buy another brand for now.

Reviews.Title: Best TV we ever owned
Reviews.Author: Karl Dickerson
Reviews.Content: My Bride of 55 years and I decided to get one of those "Smart TV's" , so I went to Wal-Marts in Xenia, Ohio to see if we could get a deal on a new smart TV. I looked around seeing all those high prices for a 55" or 60" TV and decided to ask the sales lady if they had and "open box or returns" on big TV's. She showed me a Hisense 55" [55K610GWN]. I saw new ones in the isle but she had one just returned for $545. I knew nothing about the brand but checked it out and it  is the 5th. leading TV sold in China and it had the full warren......so I purchased it with the OK to bring it back if it didn't work. We got it home and started  putting it together and found that the folks that first got it didn't know how to put the base onto the TV. After getting the right bolts from my stash and downloading the manual for TV, we had it up and running in no time. WOW....when they say SMART TV they aren't kidding. This thing has all a person would want: Netflix, Pandora,Picasa,Vudu,Utube, complete internet on screen, with Emails, etc. all from my router upstairs. All I can say, it is the BEST TV we have ever owned and we highly recommend it to one and all.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This TV is an exceptional deal.  The quality of the picture is great.  Compared to other LED televisions this is a steal.  It's like having a television and a computer all in one.  The only thing that is not great is the volume. The sound quality is good but the volume could have been of better quality.  But with a surround system you won't have to worry.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: M. SPEIGHTS
Reviews.Content: We had purchased a Hisense TV for our living/dining area a couple years ago and have loved it, so when our Rec Room Mitsubishi DLP kept requiring bulb replacements, we decided to give it away and bought another 65" Hisense--this time with 3D.  It performs amazingly, and the 3D is superb!  We had a little trouble installing the batteries in the 3D glasses, but once seated, they work very well.  We highly recommend the Hisense, which is every bit as bright as any of the higher priced TVs.  You will not be sorry you purchased it!

Reviews.Title: Hisense.....INCREDIBLE
Reviews.Author: NYer4 ever
Reviews.Content: This Hisense picture is absolutely the best quality I ever seen... Hisense must stand for high sensitivity. Watching movies will take some time to get use to watching bc this Hisense makes you feel like you are the director of the film. There's nothing negative to say about this brand. Once people get word of this brand, I am positive it will flood the market... I did purchase the 5 warranty bc I am just that kind of person.  This smart tv has Netflix on the remote so Ez to use for an additional 8 a month.... The point is the wifi is very Ez to set up... I love love love this television.. I will be purchasing another within the year!

Reviews.Title: Horrible customer service
Reviews.Author: Jinnie "Jinnie"
Reviews.Content: Bought a 50" Hisense TV in April, by December the picture went black. It took Hisense 3 weeks to get me a shipping label. After wrapping TV with foam & padding we shipped it back. After 2 more weeks we heard back from them via email letting us know that they weren't going to warranty it due to the screen being cracked upon delivery. So then starts the back and forth on a supposed UPS claim. Another 3 weeks go by and several calls to Hisense with a threat of an attorney, they tell me that UPS denied the claim. So I asked to see a copy of the denial letter...still haven't seen anything & it's been a month ....don't buy a Hisense!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Normal Guy
Reviews.Content: Is there any glaring problems with this tv? NoDoes it function properly? Yes, mostlyI bought this tv on cyber Monday for $700, hoping I hit the jackpot. After setting up the tv and messing around with the settings I had come to the conclusion that I more or less got what I had paid for. A 55inch 3D tv from an off brand. The picture isn't as sharp as it could be, the tv probably needs a sound bar and the 3D function isn't a strong point.This is a smart TV, but connecting the wifi was a bit tricky, I had to do a lot of troubleshooting. Also, after having the tv for about a month, I haven't been able to use the pandora app. The netflix app works fine and has a direct access button from the remote which is nice. However, this tv does not have the amazon instant video app which would be nice.Overall this tv is a 3/5, at least for the price I paid. I would not buy it at full price however as  I would rather invest in a nicer tv.

Reviews.Title: So far, it's great!
Reviews.Author: CityGirl1 "gp"
Reviews.Content: It looks spectacular.  Love the swivel aspect.  I've only had it for 3 weeks but so fr, no complaints.  I had never heard of Hisense and took a chance.  Ask me again in about 6 months.

Reviews.Title: Quality Picture and quick setup
Reviews.Author: Gary Freitag
Reviews.Content: Never had any problems setting up this smart tv - picked up my wi-fi instantly.  The only issue I have with this unit is the poor sound quality.  I had to purchase a separate sound bar to enhance.  Other than that, I give this unit a 4 for quality.  Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, but not great (3.5 stars)...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: ...everything about the TV is great (looks beautiful, very thin, solid build, functionality as expected).Taking off a star since there is a cluster of 4 white clouds that are very obvious when the screen is dark (e.g., a black image is shown), taking up the entire screen.  I haven't been able to eliminate the back light bleeding using contrast/brightness/color settings.  It does not seem to be a mfr defect (and I'm not able to detect any dead pixels or anything indicating the product was damaged during shipping).  The unit is so solid and heavy that I don't want to even try to get it exchanged (took three people to safely get it out of the box and set up).Half-a-star off due to lack of availability of extra active glasses in the US that work with this TV (found the right kind through trusted sellers out of China for $12-18 a piece, including shipping), but have been waiting for over a month for them to arrive (and still no word/tracking info).  The one or two US middle-men out of US have a 400+% mark-up, which is a no-go.  (Hisense should make the compatible glasses available through their site at a reasonable, but not outrageous mark-up.)As a side note, the included glasses work very well (even over prescription glass), but are very light and flimsy, so I can see them getting scratched, bend and break easily.  If I could easily buy backups for $15/ea and not have to wait months to get them, the lightness of the glasses would actually be a huge plus over typical active glasses I've used in the pass.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Adam Allgood
Reviews.Content: A Very bright picture....loads and play Netflix really well. I highly recommend this TV to anyone wanting a 3D TV.

Reviews.Title: best TV ever
Reviews.Author: Dr. Diane CLinton
Reviews.Content: This is the best picture I have seen on a 65" TV!!! I bought extra glasses for the three D direct from Hisense because amazon wasnt sure of compatibility with this new series of TV. I love the 3D quality! The remote is also easy to use even for children! the cable company had the box and remote hooked up extremely easy. when the installer left he was writing down info to order his own the same day!

Reviews.Title: It's great TV for this price!
Reviews.Author: Aqua
Reviews.Content: Although it crushes easily...it often shuts down by itself when I enjoy watching Netflix programs through this TV. But it has a lot of great features and functions over all.

Reviews.Title: Best Picture
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV after seeing a smaller version in the store. The picture was super clear...better then most top brands. Love the Smart TV feature and the 3D is like 3D at the movies. Great buy!!

Reviews.Title: Warning!! Buy another TV.
Reviews.Author: bryan stewart
Reviews.Content: Bought a Hisense Model 50K610GW from Walmart for my living room.  After 6 months I get a black screen.  We call Hisense customer service department and they mail us a parts package based on what they believe the problem was. After a week or 2 we receive the package and call Hisense who schedules a repair man to come repair the TV 2 weeks after that. When the repair man arrives he informs us that they sent the wrong parts. He mentioned that he could repair the TV because he knew the problem.  But he was not allowed to work on certain problems per Hisense request. He also mentioned that he's worked on a lot of Hisense TV's and thinks they were made to fail after 3 or so years so that people would need another one. Of course that's his opinion. Next Hisense wants us to send the TV in. They mail us a postage label for UPS which we waited another 2 weeks for and never receive. After calling back multiple times one of the customer service rep informs us that we can print the label after we receive it via email. By this time I ask to speak to a supervisor to request a refund. They tell me that one will call me back. After another week we call back to find out their district manager who was going to call me was on vacation.  Won't be back til Monday. (5 more days). But he calls back later that day. He refused to refund the TV and says send it in for repair.  The whole process would be another 3 weeks. I let him know i was disappointed with all of this and all he said was, "ok... is there anything else?"..  Lesson learned, don't buy anything from Hisense, or just shop at Costco where they would take it back hassle free.

Reviews.Title: Love my hisense
Reviews.Author: Judy Hardee
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this TV. WiFi is excellent and all the added features are great!  Definitely more bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Harry Gorby "hgorby"
Reviews.Content: this was a great deal on a great product i really love this tv and highly recommend it especially if you get it when its on sale

Reviews.Title: Great Image, terrible App/Firmware options... Netflix/Vudu only
Reviews.Author: Armando Rosario
Reviews.Content: The image quality is great. The only complaint I have is the responsiveness of the remote (with clear line-of-sight no more than 10 feet away), and the complete lack of apps/firmware options. You get Netflix and Vudu, and some REEEEALLY bad "games". After 5-6 months, still no updates to apps/firmware. Netflix runs fine, and I haven't tried Vudu since I don't care to pay for another service. I wish it supported Amazon Prime Video, so we've been using our net-enabled bluray player for that. We tried the 3D once, and it was decent, even in the 2D->3D mode (which I had no expectations of working). The bad thing about the glasses is they have NO indicator of charge/charging, or even if they are On/Off, other than putting them on, mashing buttons and waiting to see if there is a visual difference. They are active sync, and so a bit pricey to replace, and I've yet to find a pair as light as these are.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: ashleigh
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 55 inch hisense smart tv with 3d for only 724 dollars from walmart. Best purchase ever ! These are really good tvs ! No issues at all. Volume is a bit loud but i just keep the volume at about 12 !

Reviews.Title: Hisense 55 in 3D TV
Reviews.Author: R. Ghafoor "G"
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this TV.  i have had it for over a month and its works wonderfully, especially for the price.  I have not yet try the 3D, but am looking forward to it.  The only thing I do not like about the TV is that Netflix does not always come on.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV!  One shortcoming!
Reviews.Author: Thomas( Doc Savage 45)
Reviews.Content: Haven't written reviews for many years,  This was a sweet heart deal. Looked on Amazon and it's not there?  Glad I bought it when I did. The tv works well. We enjoy the 3D when we get a great Blue Ray.  2D can be enhanced but it depends on quality of the video, and it's only slightly better.Only complaint is I couldn't directly attach my older Onkyo directly. Using the mini jack because of the limited outputs. Probably not an oversight. LOL!  Can't afford a new Onkyo but we do get sound enough using the mini plug adapted to larger input plug for the sound system.Bought the backup service plan. (haven't needed it but???)The TV was delivered and unpacked as promised.Glasses are a bit cumbersome but work well.As I said went back to find it and it was not there.I'd do this again!

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV in budget
Reviews.Author: Tarapad Debnath
Reviews.Content: This is grate product it has all good features like Smart TV, 3D TV, clear and cripes picture and nice sound quality. All apps are good like VUDU (including 3D streaming). YouTube. Netflix work fine but the Interface is not smooth. Opera browser also not smoothly working. Do not have lots of app support.Overall grate TV and amazing 3D experience with the low price.

Reviews.Title: Just a basic review
Reviews.Author: Joshua P Cassidy
Reviews.Content: For the price of this TV, it is well worth it. When I ordered it, the reviews were very high. However, recently the reviews have been lower. I think the people who rated it low expected something that would generally cost 4 times or more.I don't use cable for my TV. I use Antenna, soon to try Netflix, but also home brewed videos.The quality on the antenna is exceptional. I live on the outskirts of a major metro area, and It picked up more stations than I had on my previous television/CV box. If you are using Antenna, you do not need a converter box any longer.The interface to set it up is simple. As long as you have basic technical knowledge, you won't have problems. I plan on setting up a NAS, and am hoping that it will not be too complex to get it to see it. If I remember I will update this review when that time comes.If there was one complaint I would make, it would be assembling the stand. The 2nd set of screws you put in did not align. I got it as close as I could and they would not go in completely. The screws got stripped, and I had to use some spare ones I had at home(slightly smaller head), which seemed to work fine. If you have this problem, then when you put in the last set of screws(5 I believe), they will be misaligned, and more than likely the stand will not be stable. I can't say how mounting it to a wall will be, since I didn't do it, but I think it would be easier, as long as you have assistance.Other than that, issue, the picture quality is very good. Like I said, I use antenna. If the station you connect to is borderline to where you are located, you will have issues where the picture gets jumbled or even completely cutoff. That is normal for any TV using antenna. It also picked up more stations than my previous convertor box did. If you use cable, Netflix, NAS, or another type of interface, I am sure the picture will be as good, if not better.One final note: If you have kids, or animals, and plan to use the stand, try to find something you can mount the TV to a stud, so if it does get hit, it will not falloff and get cracked, or worse.

Reviews.Title: FEEL cheated
Reviews.Author: Barbara Woitalla
Reviews.Content: The TV is of good quality, But when it comes down to the what we ordered I think you took advantage of us.  The box says 120HZ, but on the back of the TV it says 60HZ what is with that.  Is that how you run things by cheating the customer, and sending them something less.  We think the TV is good and picture is clear and we are enjoying.  But it still leaves the question of Did you send what we ordered?

Reviews.Title: Good TV so far, just shy of Great
Reviews.Author: Pigs_Fly
Reviews.Content: Had the TV for a bit, and I'm pretty pleased so far.  I did have to order a sound bar, not that the sound isn't good quality, but it really is lacking in volume.  With the dishwasher running in the kitchen and the washer going in a laundry room (with the door closed) I have to have it at 95%-100% to hear some shows or movies good, not on all channels or DVDs, but enough to require extra speakers to enjoy yourself.In letterbox I see no light bleed around the edges, and the blacks are very nice, the colors are very bright.  The 3D glasses have small lenses and are not the most comfortable.  Wish it came with 4 sets instead of just two.  The 3D glasses and lack of volume decrease it by a star, but the rest of my playing with the TV has been quite nice.Will update as time goes on, but so far for $1499 it is a good buy.--Updated June 6th--For those that find they need more sound, I purchased a Sony HT-CT260 Soundbar.  If you take off the small stand brackets it is actually short enough to set infront of the TV and even on top of the TV base, but doesn't block any of the screen.  Was hard to find this soundbar since everywhere is out of stock, even Amazon, with no projected due in dates.  I purchased mine from TigerDirect for $299. This soundbar has multiple input options which is great since this TV only has the audio out in digital coaxial or 3.5.  I used the coaxial and it sounds great with more than enough volume, plus a wireless base speaker too.

Reviews.Title: Great picture!
Reviews.Author: M. Glavin
Reviews.Content: We have been very happy with our Hisense TV.  The picture is very clear and crisp..... People always comment on how good the picture is.  It is slim, protruding from the wall only 2 to 3 inches. We did have a minor issue with our TV within the first week of purchase. A HDMI port burnt out. However the company sent someone out with in days to replace the port.  Their customer service was excellent and the shipping was very fast.As far as the 3-D goes, we really don't use it that much because not many programs are not aired in 3-D… However when we have used it is very realistic and difficult to watch for long periods of time because it is very tiring for the eye/brain to keep up.... If I had anything bad to say about the TV It would be regarding the 3-D glasses. You do have to keep them charged. We don't use the 3-D option regularly so we don't keep them charged.  When we do want to use it takes about an 3 hours to charge them up...

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV Fantastic Price
Reviews.Author: J. GODFREY
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for the price. It s packed with features i.e. Smart TV with built in wifi with Netflix, Pandora, Vudu etc. It is also a 3D TV. I have not tested the 3D yet so I cannot rate that. The picture is also very good. The price of this TV for all of the features cannot be beat.The only thing I don't like about the TV is whenever the TV is off there is a very bright blue light at the bottom of the TV. It can be very annoying.

Reviews.Title: awesome deal
Reviews.Author: Stephen Turner
Reviews.Content: awesome deal & the price is fair.. colors are brilliant not washed out. I highly recommend this tv 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Great Bang For Your Buck!
Reviews.Author: P. Rucker "Phil R"
Reviews.Content: I love this tv. It's easy to install from the box to complete programming and hook up was a half hour. Wifi works great with this tv. The picture is awesome. If your looking for a good tv, this is one. Good luck

Reviews.Title: The PPQ cannot be beat.
Reviews.Author: Evan Stapp "3,500 books and counting"
Reviews.Content: My TV came with 2pair of the rechargeable glasses. They are marvelous. TV doesn't hurt the eyes much in 3d mode. It has a function to turn 2d TV into 3d. It works and is amusing but no replacement for a film actually shot in 3d. The screen is edge lit which is phenomenal 98% of the time. In dark screen the edge-lit corners are brighter than the rest of the screen noticeably. It is actually nice but will bother some people. The stand is awesome. The mounting profile on the back is small and this TV will actually mount to wall stand that are too small to support it. To be safe a new wall bracket should probably be bought and mounted. The screen is a bulletproof piece by Hitachi. Hi-sense USA are the people to call with any problems, or to order additional glasses. Just to be safe since the glasses models for the different spec'd TV's vary wildly in design and technology used for 3d. They are a Chinese company in case that bothers you. The quality aesthetics and functionality all feel south Korean though so you shouldn't worry. The only fear i have with this TV is longevity. That has not been proven to me and only time with give me that experience. If it is soon, i will re-post. Enjoy the TV it is worth the money. Samsung models are double the price and not THAT much better.

Reviews.Title: best picture ever
Reviews.Author: carl carlentini
Reviews.Content: I sit 7 feet away from the 55 inch hisense,and it is the best picture ever.Amazon got the tv to me quickly and on time.The 3d is awsome. I saw 2d to 3d before and it was a joke,but not on this one!

Reviews.Title: Ok....but I should have waited......not as good as reviews given.
Reviews.Author: TJ
Reviews.Content: Got this Tv on a cyber Monday sale and thought I had struck the jackpot based on the prior reviews.....( I wonder what Tv are they looking at). I have the Hisense 55T710DW55". Nice size and fills up my cabinet nicely however that's where it ends. It almost looks like a Samsung looking at the base and design of the Tv when it's off but thats the only thing it borrowed from Samsung. Keep in mind I'm comparing this Tv to my 3 year old Samsung 46" 640. This Tv displays letters that are not crisp and sharp compared the the Samsung. Does not seem to have the same depth of field either. Cannot handle SD signals ( or over the air ) very well and the aspect shrinks ....however on the Samsung ....it handles it quite well......so far it has only shrank one channel compared to the Hisense which hits everything under 720 hard!!! Try enlarging the picture and the letters get even more blurrier than before. You are in between a rock and a hard place trying to set this up......I am not use to this. Let move on to the 3D feature of this Tv which ( The Samsung looks like it displays in 3D on the regular settings compared to this model.) is easy to turn on ( The 3D feature )but trying to get those glasses charged and trying to pair this to em .......I've been at it all day ( Sat ) since about 7am and I still haven't gotten a full charge to pair em to the Tv but when looking thru them ( seemingly uncharged ) the picture was not so blurry but the was not the incredible picture I was expecting either. I would strongly suggest you check this out in person.The app section sucks majorly...the only good thing is it has a built in netflix app so you are view you movies without having to hookup and external box but you will need to add a sound bar for sure.....the sound is hollow and thin...........but hey....what do you expect when you spend under $650 to purchase a Tv? It's not worth the regular price in my opinion.....look at other brands and get more bang for your buck!!!

Reviews.Title: Wireless doesn't work at all. Otherwise a nice TV
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: It has a great picture. The 3D is a little annoying to have to setup and the glasses need to be charged. You only get two and so for our whole family to watch i'll need to pick up another two (quick search shows anywhere from $15 to $99 per).Honestly i really like this TV but one of it's big selling features for me was that i wouldn't have to switch to another device to use Netflix or other apps this handles. The problem is the wireless feature doesn't work at all. I have my Laptop, Wii, Dvd player and other devices all able to find my wireless AP but not the TV.I'll update again after i find out what support is willing to do. I have not tried wiring the device with Ethernet cable nor do i plan to as i don't want additional wires.UPDATE: They sent a new board in the mail. A local guy installed it and turned it on. At first it still didn't work but then for some reason unplugging it and turning it on again fixed it.Netflix worked but to get Pandora working i had to update the firmweare (took about 10 minutes). Funky icons the first time it booted after update but then i powered it off and on again and it now has correct app images and Pandora worked.The only real issues with the TV is it takes a while to start up. Flips between the red led for power and the white glow light at the bottom can be 10 seconds before i see the Hisense logo. Also i still need to buy 2 extra 3D glasses so the family can all enjoy it together.Moved this up to 4 stars from 3 when the wireless wasn't working.

Reviews.Title: Great except "No ap" Error when connecting to wifi & sound difference
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I love the screen quality. It looks wonderful (haven't even tried 3D or Bluray yet)! It takes a little longer than other TVs to get turned on, but that's not a problem for me, it isn't a long wait. It looks beautiful. It is very light and easy to swivel on my mount.I enjoy the sound sometimes... it seems to depend on what I'm watching. When I'm watching DirecTV I don't need the volume up much, but if I'm watching something from Amazon Instant Video or Netflix through my Xbox, I have to turn the volume up quite a bit to hear it. I wonder if this would be solved by a new HDMI cable or by accessing directly through the "Smart TV" Netflix app.Problem with accessing Apps directly is that when I try to detect a wifi network (following the instruction manual that came with it), it tells me "No ap."  I'm assuming that means No Access Point. This TV should support Wifi and all of my other devices can find my Wifi no problem. The TV doesn't even do the search for Wifi networks.I will be contacting their support VERY SOON. I will update based on my response from their support team and the help I get. If the sound was more consistent and the Wifi worked it would be 5 stars for me.

Reviews.Title: no audio hook up
Reviews.Author: mary
Reviews.Content: great picture one really bad thing no way to hook up home theater system this is a major flaw thinking about return before you buy look at the connections there is none for home theater called support they said same thing this is bad.

Reviews.Title: Buying in unhappy
Reviews.Author: Long le
Reviews.Content: I love this TV , thinness , good shape , looking nice , and new technology, but there are not fairness on adverting that posted on Amazon , (920 x 1080 full HD 120Hz, 3D, Smart edge-lit LED3D Active with 2 pair glasses included, Energy Star 5.34 HDMI connections)when we got this TV from shipping coupes , the TV was missed some parts ,and manufacturer sent us only 1 pair of 3D glassesthere are some problem in their business , but we don't want to issue any more thing to discuss with them , or return it to them .

Reviews.Title: READ THIS THE NIGHTMARE WILL HIT YOU IF YOU BUY
Reviews.Author: TIGER
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM HISENSE I COULD GO THROUGH MY STORY BUT IT IS UP TO YOU BUT BEWARE GARBAGE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy HiSense TV
Reviews.Author: John D.
Reviews.Content: HiSense has the worst customer service. Their tvs are terrible and if you google "HiSense tvs suck" you will see what I mean. I had mine for 90 days. It went bad and I sent it back. They would not honor the 1 year warranty. Save some time, don't buy a HiSense product!

ProductInfo.Features:
1920 x 1080, 240 Hz, Smart, 3D LED TV, edge-lit
Super narrow frame with Wi-Fi, DLNA, Energy Star 5.3
4 HDMI connections
Dimensions: 58.4 x 15.2 x 37 inches with stand and 58.4 x 2.2 x 34.5 inches without stand
ProductInfo.Name: Hisense 65K560DW 65-Inch 1080p 240Hz 3D Internet LED HDTV
